publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2237 Mr Adam Ingram: Mental Health Week 10 - 16 October 2001-That the Parliament supports the sentiments behind Mental Health Week, congratulates all the parents, carers, professionals and organisations who support and care for those affected by a mental illness, and believes that this kind of initiative is an effective tool in awareness campaigning and that it comes at an appropriate time coinciding with the review of the Mental Health (Scotland) Act 1984. Supported by: Mr Keith Raffan*

S1M-2237 Mr Adam Ingram: Mental Health Week 10 - 16 October 2001-That the Parliament supports the sentiments behind Mental Health Week, congratulates all the parents, carers, professionals and organisations who support and care for those affected by a mental illness, and believes that this kind of initiative is an effective tool in awareness campaigning and that it comes at an appropriate time coinciding with the review of the Mental Health (Scotland) Act 1984. Supported by: Mr Keith Raffan, David Mundell*
S1M-2237 Mental Health Week 10 - 16 October 2001 (lodged on 19 September 2001) Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Shona Robison*
S1M-2237 Mental Health Week 10 - 16 October 2001 (lodged on 19 September 2001) Michael Matheson*, Christine Grahame*, Alex Neil*
S1M-2237 Mental Health Week 10 - 16 October 2001 (lodged on 19 September 2001) Cathy Peattie*, Karen Whitefield*, Ms Sandra White*, Mr Murray Tosh*, Tricia Marwick*
S1M-2237 Mental Health Week, 10-16 October 2001 (lodged on 19 September 2001) Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Michael Russell*, John Scott*, Robin Harper*, Robert Brown*

S1M-2237 Mr Adam Ingram: Mental Health Week, 10-16 October 2001-That the Parliament supports the sentiments behind Mental Health Week, congratulates all the parents, carers, professionals and organisations who support and care for those affected by a mental illness, and believes that this kind of initiative is an effective tool in awareness campaigning and that it comes at an appropriate time coinciding with the review of the Mental Health (Scotland) Act 1984. Supported by: Mr Keith Raffan, David Mundell, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Shona Robison, Michael Matheson, Christine Grahame, Alex Neil, Cathy Peattie, Karen Whitefield, Ms Sandra White, Mr Murray Tosh, Tricia Marwick, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Michael Russell, John Scott, Robin Harper, Robert Brown, Dorothy-Grace Elder*, Fiona McLeod*
S1M-2237 Mental Health Week, 10-16 October 2001 (lodged on 19 September 2001) Kay Ullrich*
S1M-2237 Mental Health Week, 10-16 October 2001 (lodged on 19 September 2001) Mr Gil Paterson*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*
S1M-2237 Mental Health Week, 10-16 October 2001 (lodged on 19 September 2001) Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Brian Adam*
S1M-2237 Mental Health Week, 10-16 October 2001 (lodged on 19 September 2001) Mary Scanlon*, Andrew Wilson*
S1M-2237 Mental Health Week, 10-16 October 2001 (lodged on 19 September 2001) Linda Fabiani*
S1M-2237 Mental Health Week, 10-16 October 2001 (lodged on 19 September 2001) Mr Duncan Hamilton*
